title: OSINT Framework
description: A comprehensive collection of free OSINT tools and resources categorized by type, maintained by Justin Nordine. Essential for intelligence gathering.

title: MITRE ATT&CK Framework
description: A globally accessible knowledge base of adversary tactics and techniques based on real-world observations. Crucial for threat modeling and defense.

title: Volatility Framework
description: An open-source memory forensics framework for extracting digital artifacts from volatile memory (RAM) samples. Key for incident response.

title: Sigma Rules
description: Generic and open signature format for SIEM systems, allowing security analysts to describe detected malicious behavior across various logs.

title: Awesome-Red-Teaming
description: A curated list of Red Teaming frameworks, libraries, and software for penetration testers and red teamers to simulate realistic attacks.

title: MalwareBazaar
description: A project from abuse.ch that collects, vets, and shares malware samples to help IT-security researchers and threat analysts. Provides IOCs.

title: The SOC Analyst Guide
description: A comprehensive guide for aspiring and current SOC analysts, covering essential skills, tools, and processes for effective security operations.

title: Wireshark
description: The worldâ€™s foremost and widely used network protocol analyzer. Essential for network forensics and troubleshooting.

title: Nmap (Network Mapper)
description: A free and open-source utility for network discovery and security auditing. Widely used for port scanning and vulnerability assessment.

title: Shodan
description: The search engine for the Internet of Things (IoT) and connected devices. Discover publicly accessible devices and services.

title: Metasploit Framework
description: A penetration testing framework that makes it easy to write, test, and execute exploit code. A primary tool for red teamers.

title: Autopsy
description: A leading open-source digital forensics platform used to analyze hard drives and smartphones. Supports various forensic tasks.

title: CyberChef
description: The Cyber Swiss Army Knife - a web app for encryption, encoding, compression and data analysis. Indispensable for security analysts.

title: Have I Been Pwned?
description: A free resource for anyone to check if their email address or phone number has been compromised in a data breach.

title: Kali Linux
description: A Debian-derived Linux distribution designed for digital forensics and penetration testing. Comes with pre-installed security tools.

title: Snort
description: An open-source network intrusion detection system (IDS) capable of performing real-time traffic analysis and packet logging.

title: YARA Rules
description: A pattern matching tool for malware researchers. Used to identify and classify malware samples based on textual or binary patterns.

title: CISA Cybersecurity Advisories
description: Official advisories and alerts from the Cybersecurity and Infrastructure Security Agency (CISA) on current threats and vulnerabilities.

title: BloodHound
description: A tool that uses graph theory to reveal hidden and unintended relationships within an Active Directory environment, crucial for privilege escalation.

title: Awesome-DFIR
description: A community-curated list of delightful Digital Forensics and Incident Response resources, tools, and scripts.

title: Ghidorah (Reverse Engineering)
description: A powerful open-source reverse engineering tool suite developed by the NSA.

title: Palo Alto Networks Blog
description: Insights and analysis on cybersecurity threats, vulnerabilities, and industry trends from Palo Alto Networks experts.

title: Splunk (Free/Dev)
description: A leading platform for searching, monitoring, and analyzing machine-generated big data via a web-style interface.

title: The Hacker News
description: A leading, trusted, and independent cybersecurity news source. Provides comprehensive coverage of the latest cyber threats.

title: SANS Institute Reading Room
description: A vast collection of free cybersecurity research papers and articles covering a wide range of topics.

title: Burp Suite Community Edition
description: An integrated platform for performing security testing of web applications. Essential for web pentesting.

title: Censys
description: An attack surface management platform that continuously maps the internet and discovers internet-facing assets.

title: MISP (Malware Information Sharing Platform)
description: An open-source threat intelligence platform for sharing, storing, and correlating indicators of compromise.

title: Awesome-OSINT
description: A GitHub repository compiling a list of resources for Open Source Intelligence (OSINT).

title: Elastic Stack (ELK Stack)
description: A group of open-source products from Elastic designed to help users take data from any source, in any format, and search, analyze, and visualize it in real-time.

title: Responder
description: A LLMNR, NBT-NS and MDNS poisoner, designed to answer specific queries and capture hashes from unauthenticated network traffic.

title: GRR Rapid Response
description: An open-source incident response framework focused on remote live forensics. Allows collection and analysis of forensic data.

title: VirusTotal
description: A free online service that analyzes suspicious files and URLs to detect types of malware using various antivirus engines and website blacklisting services.

title: PowerShell Empire
description: A post-exploitation framework built on PowerShell and Python. Offers a range of modules for privilege escalation and lateral movement.

title: Sysmon (Sysinternals)
description: A Windows system service that monitors and logs system activity to the Windows event log, providing detailed information for security analysis.

title: Threat Intelligence Platforms (TIPs) Overview
description: An article discussing the role and benefits of various Threat Intelligence Platforms in cybersecurity operations.

title: OpenVAS / Greenbone Vulnerability Management
description: A comprehensive open-source vulnerability scanning and management system. Identifies security weaknesses in networks and applications.

title: Security Onion
description: A free and open-source Linux distribution for threat hunting, enterprise security monitoring, and log management.

title: OSINT Techniques for Social Media
description: A guide exploring various open-source intelligence techniques specifically tailored for gathering information from social media platforms.

title: Digital Forensics Basics: Chain of Custody
description: An article explaining the critical concept of Chain of Custody in digital forensics, ensuring evidence integrity.

title: OWASP Top 10
description: A standard awareness document for developers and web application security. Represents the most critical security risks to web applications.

title: Hack The Box
description: An online platform allowing individuals, companies, and universities to practice their penetration testing skills.

title: ThreatConnect
description: A leading Threat Intelligence Platform (TIP) that aggregates, analyzes, and acts on threat intelligence.

title: Case Management for Incident Response
description: Best practices and tools for managing cybersecurity incidents effectively from detection to resolution.

title: Blue Team Labs Online (BTLO)
description: A platform offering free and paid labs to practice defensive cybersecurity skills, including SOC and DFIR scenarios.

title: Maltego
description: An open-source intelligence (OSINT) and graphical link analysis tool for gathering and connecting information.

title: Cybersecurity Certifications Guide
description: An overview of popular cybersecurity certifications and career paths.

title: XDR (Extended Detection and Response) Explained
description: An article detailing the evolution from EDR to XDR and its benefits for holistic threat detection.

title: Cobalt Strike
description: A commercial red team framework that allows adversary simulations and post-exploitation activities.

title: Deep Dive into File Carving
description: A detailed technical article explaining the process and techniques of file carving in digital forensics.
